River-crossing exercise staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
River-crossing exercise staged in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- The "Sungjin" unit of the South Korean army staged an all-out offensive river-crossing operation exercise on April 1 in the wake of its field tactical mobile drill for 2003, according to KBS of South Korea.
 Tanks, armored cars and other combat vehicles and huge troops underwent training in rapidly securing a bridgehead by use of river-crossing equipment of u.s. forces.
 An ultra modern information radar system was reportedly used in the drill for the first time.

Foreign guests appreciate Taekwon-do exhibition
articles.content:
Foreign guests appreciate Taekwon-do exhibition 
    Pyongyang, April 4 (KCNA) -- A Taekwon-do exhibition was appreciated by diplomatic envoys, embassy officials, resident representatives and members of international organizations here at the Taekwon-do hall on Thursday on the occasion of the 91st birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
 The exhibition troupe of the Korean Taekwon-do Committee ensured collectivity of movement in team patterns and performed perfect skills in pantile- and brick-crushing and pine board-breaking in different positions, showing the might and special techniques of Taekwon-do, orthodox martial arts and pride of the Korean nation, which left deep impressions upon spectators.    
 It was also seen by Hwang Pong Yong, chairman of the Korean Taekwon-do Committee, officials concerned, Taekwon-do fans and working people in Pyongyang.
